 D     D/C#                  Am/C
It's a god-awful small affair
      B7                     Em
To the girl with the mousy hair
      Em/D 					 C#/A
But her mummy is yelling "No"
        A                     D
And her daddy has told her to go
        D/C#                       Am/C
But her friend is nowhere to be seen
        B7                         Em
Now she walks through her sunken dream
      Em/D                        C#/A
To the seat with the clearest view
          A                    F/C
And she's hooked to the silver screen
         A/C#                 Dm
But the film is a saddening bore
       F/Eb                            Bb
'Cause she's lived it ten times or more
          D/F#                   Gm
She could spit in the eyes of fools
        Bb/Ab
As they ask her to focus on

 G        C
Sailors fighting in the dance hall
 Em      Eb+                 D   Dm
Oh man! Look at those cavemen go
                     Am   Cm
It's the freakiest show
                      G
Take a look at the Lawman
 C
Beating up the wrong guy
 Em      Eb+                   D   Dm
Oh man! Wonder if he'll ever know
                           Am   Cm
He's in the best selling show
                   Em  Baug  Em7  A7
Is there life on Mars?
 
 
[Interlude]
D B7/D Em C#7/F F#m A7/G Gm7

[Verse 2]
 
It's on Amerika's tortured brow
That Mickey Mouse has grown up a cow
Now the workers have struck for fame
'Cause Lennon's on sale again
See the mice in their million hordes
From Ibiza to the Norfolk Broads
Rule Britannia is out of bounds
To my mother, my dog, and clowns
But the film is a saddening bore
'Cause I wrote it ten times or more
It's about to be writ again
As I ask you to focus on
 

Am7 C G
[Refrain]

D D/C# Am/C It’s a god-awful small affair B7 Em To the girl with the mousy hair Em/D C#/A But her mummy is yelling “No” A D And her daddy has told her to go D/C# Am/C But her friend is nowhere to be seen B7 Em Now she walks through her sunken dream Em/D C#/A To the seat with the clearest view A F/C And she’s hooked to the silver screen A/C# Dm But the film is a saddening bore F/Eb Bb ‘Cause she’s lived it ten times or more D/F# Gm She could spit in the eyes of fools Bb/Ab As they ask her to focus on

G C Sailors fighting in the dance hall Em Eb+ D Dm Oh man! Look at those cavemen go Am Cm It’s the freakiest show G Take a look at the Lawman C Beating up the wrong guy Em Eb+ D Dm Oh man! Wonder if he’ll ever know Am Cm He’s in the best selling show Em Baug Em7 A7 Is there life on Mars?

[Interlude] D B7/D Em C#7/F F#m A7/G Gm7

[Verse 2]

It’s on Amerika’s tortured brow That Mickey Mouse has grown up a cow Now the workers have struck for fame ‘Cause Lennon’s on sale again See the mice in their million hordes From Ibiza to the Norfolk Broads Rule Britannia is out of bounds To my mother, my dog, and clowns But the film is a saddening bore ‘Cause I wrote it ten times or more It’s about to be writ again As I ask you to focus on
